intro: Claoxylon indicum var. scabratum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed claoxylon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. It is often found in lowland forests and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties. The bark and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic effects.
